required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of Transcervical Foley Catheter and Prostaglandins for Induction of Labor at Term

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the effectiveness and safety of transcervical foley catheter as compared to prostaglandins for preinduction cervical ripening and labor induction in term nulliparous women with unfavorable cervix.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Twelve hours of initiating oxytocin on the fist day of induction
primary_outcome.description: Successful labor induction is defined as an ability to achieve the active phase of labor corresponding to a cervical dilatation of >=4cm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cervical change in the bishop scores and cervical lengths induced by transcervical foley catheter and prostaglandins
secondary_outcome.time_frame: When transcervical foley catheter or prostagladins was removed befor adminitoring oxytocin
secondary_outcome.description: Cervical change based on the bishop score and cervical length induced by cervical ripening method(foley catheter balloon vs prostaglandin) Incidence of cesarean delivery Vaginal delivery with 24 hours of starting of induction The interval from start of oxytocin to delivery Incidence of admission to neonatal intensive care unit and uterine tachysystole Pain score by the type of ripening method

intervention.description: 16 French foley catheter 10mg dinoprostone vaginal insert

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- singleton pregnancy
- nulliparous women
- gestational age >= 37.0 weeks
- Bishop score <= 5
- intact amniotic membrane
- abscence of labor
- live fetus with vertex presentation
- no previous uterine surgical procedure
Exclusion Criteria:
- major congenital anomaly

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology Seoul National University Bundang Hospital

clinical_study.keyword: labor induction, transcervical foley catheter, prostaglandin
